Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the class IIa bacteriocin
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Structure Description: In this study, we found that piscicocin CS526, which possessed YGNGL sequence, had anti-Listeria activity typical of class IIa bacteriocins. Accordingly, the presence of Val7 within the YGNGV7 motif could not be a prerequisite for the antimicrobial activity of class IIa bacteriocins.
Sequence Information.Comments: The bacteriocin piscicocin CS526 was inactivated by proteolytic enzymes, was stable at 100 Celsius degree for 30 min, had a pH range of 2 to 8, and was active against Enterococcus, Listeria, Pediococcus, and Leuconostoc.

Literature.Title: Purification and characterization of a novel class IIa bacteriocin, piscicocin CS526, from surimi-associated Carnobacterium piscicola CS526.
Literature.Author: Yamazaki K, Suzuki M, Kawai Y, Inoue N, Montville TJ.

Literature.Title: Mode of action of piscicocin CS526 produced by Carnobacterium piscicola CS526.
Literature.Author: Suzuki M, Yamamoto T, Kawai Y, Inoue N, Yamazaki K.
